agen.  Osteopoikilosis, which is from the Greek words for ""spotted bones,"" is a skeletal abnormality characterized by small, round areas of increased bone density that appear as brighter spots on x-rays. Osteopoikilosis usually occurs near the ends of the long bones of the arms and legs, and in the bones of the hands, feet, and pelvis. The areas of increased bone density appear during childhood. They do not cause pain or other health problems.",GHR,Buschke-Ollendorff syndrome
